intro: Pteropyrum macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited pteropyrum, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves that are divided into narrow, linear segments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its fruits are large, dry, and ridged, often containing a single seed. Pteropyrum macrocarpum is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks.
